name: format_tag
desc: A number indicating the WAVE format category of the file. The content of the <format-specific-fields> portion of the ‘fmt’ chunk, and the interpretation of the waveform data, depend on this value.

name: channels
desc: The number of channels represented in the waveform data, such as 1 for mono or 2 for stereo.

name: samples_per_sec
desc: The sampling rate (in samples per second) at which each channel should be played.

name: avg_bytes_per_sec
desc: The average number of bytes per second at which the waveform data should be transferred. Playback software can estimate the buffer size using this value.

name: block_align
desc: The block alignment (in bytes) of the waveform data. Playback software needs to process a multiple of wBlockAlign bytes of data at a time, so the value of wBlockAlign can be used for buffer alignment. The wBlockAlign field should be equal to the following formula, rounded to the next whole number: wChannels x ( wBitsPerSample / 8 )

name: bits_per_sample
desc: The wBitsPerSample field specifies the number of bits of data used to represent each sample of each channel. If there are multiple channels, the sample size is the same for each channel. The wBlockAlign field should be equal to the following formula, rounded to the next whole number: wChannels x ( wBitsPerSample / 8 )

name: text
desc: Archival Location. Indicates where the subject of the file is archived.

name: text
desc: Genre. Describes the original work, such as "landscape", "portrait", "still life", etc.

name: text
desc: Keywords. Provides a list of keywords that refer to the file or subject of the file. Separate multiple keywords with a semicolon and a blank. For example, "Seattle; aerial view; scenery".

name: text
desc: Lightness. Describes the changes in lightness settings on the digitizer required to produce the file. Note that the format of this information depends on hardware used.

name: text
desc: Medium. Describes the original subject of the file, such as "computer image", "drawing", "lithograph", and so forth.

name: text
desc: Name. Stores the title of the subject of the file, such as "Seattle From Above".

name: text
desc: Palette Setting. Specifies the number of colors requested when digitizing an image, such as "256".

name: text
desc: Product. Specifies the name of the title the file was originally intended for, such as "Encyclopedia of Pacific Northwest Geography".

name: text
desc: Subject. Describes the contents of the file, such as "Aerial view of Seattle".

name: text
desc: Software. Identifies the name of the software package used to create the file, such as "Microsoft WaveEdit".

name: text
desc: Sharpness. Identifies the changes in sharpness for the digitizer required to produce the file (the format depends on the hardware used).

name: text
desc: Artist. Lists the artist of the original subject of the file. For example, "Michaelangelo".

name: text
desc: Source. Identifies the name of the person or organization who supplied the original subject of the file. For example, "Trey Research".

name: text
desc: Source Form. Identifies the original form of the material that was digitized, such as "slide", "paper", "map", and so forth. This is not necessarily the same as IMED.

name: text
desc: Technician. Identifies the technician who digitized the subject file. For example, "Smith, John."

name: text
desc: Commissioned. Lists the name of the person or organization that commissioned the subject of the file. For example, "Pope Julian II".

name: text
desc: Comments. Provides general comments about the file or the subject of the file. If the comment is several sentences long, end each sentence with a period. Do not include newline characters.

name: text
desc: Copyright. Records the copyright information for the file. For example, "Copyright Encyclopedia International 1991." If there are multiple copyrights, separate them by a semicolon followed by a space.

name: text
desc: Creation date. Specifies the date the subject of the file was created. List dates in year-month-day format, padding one-digit months and days with a zero on the left. For example, "1553-05-03" for May 3, 1553.

name: text
desc: Cropped. Describes whether an image has been cropped and, if so, how it was cropped. For example, "lower right corner". IDIM Dimensions. Specifies the size of the original subject of the file. For example, "8.5 in h, 11 in w".

name: text
desc: Dots Per Inch. Stores dots per inch setting of the digitizer used to produce the file, such as "300".

name: text
desc: Engineer. Stores the name of the engineer who worked on the file. If there are multiple engineers, separate the names by a semicolon and a blank. For example, "Smith, John; Adams, Joe".

name: text
desc: SMPTE time code of digitization start point expressed as a NULL terminated text string "HH:MM:SS.FF". If performing MCI capture in AVICAP, this chunk will be automatically set based on the MCI start time.

name: text
desc: Digitization Time. Specifies the time and date that digitization commenced. The digitization time is contained in an ASCII string which contains exactly 26 characters and is in the format "Wed Jan 02 02:03:55 1990\n\0". The ctime(), asctime(), functions can be used to create strings in this format. This chunk is automatically added to the capture file based on the current system time at the moment capture is initiated.

name: code_page
desc: Specifies the code page used for file elements. If the CSET chunk is not present, or if this field has value zero, assume standard ISO 8859/1 code page (identical to code page 1004 without code points defined in hex columns 0, 1, 8, and 9).

name: country_code
desc: Specifies the country code used for file elements. See “ Country Codes,” following this section, for a list of currently defined country codes. If the CSET chunk is not present, or if this field has value zero, assume USA (country code 001).

name: language
desc: Specify the language and dialect used for file elements. See “Language and Dialect Codes,” later in this chapter, for a list of language and dialect codes. If the CSET chunk is not present, or if these fields have value zero, assume US English (language code 9, dialect code 1).

name: dialect
desc: Specify the language and dialect used for file elements. See “Language and Dialect Codes,” later in this chapter, for a list of language and dialect codes. If the CSET chunk is not present, or if these fields have value zero, assume US English (language code 9, dialect code 1).

name: samples
desc: Number of samples. RIFF1991 named this field dwFileSize, even though it's documented as "Number of samples"

name: cue_points
desc: Count of cue points. The number of times the cue-point struct repeats within this chunk.

name: name
desc: cue-point field: Specifies the cue point name. Each <cue-point> record must have a unique dwName field.

name: position
desc: cue-point field: Specifies the sample position of the cue point. This is the sequential sample number within the play order. See [`plst`](@/chunk/plst.md) chunk, for a discussion of the play order.

name: chunk_id
desc: cue-point field: Specifies the name or chunk ID of the chunk containing the cue point.

name: chunk_start
desc: cue-point field: Specifies the file position of the start of the chunk containing the cue point. This is a byte offset relative to the start of the data section of the ‘wavl’ LIST chunk.

name: block_start
desc: cue-point field: Specifies the file position of the start of the block containing the position. This is a byte offset relative to the start of the data section of the ‘wavl’ LIST chunk.

name: sample_offset
desc: cue-point field: Specifies the sample offset of the cue point relative to the start of the block.

name: segments
desc: Count of play segments.

name: name
desc: play-segment field: Specifies the cue point name. This value must match one of the names listed in the [cue](@/chunk/cue.md) cue-point table.

name: length
desc: play-segment field: Specifies the length of the section in samples.

name: loops
desc: play-segment field: Specifies the number of times to play the section.

name: id
desc: The ‘labl’ chunk contains a label, or title, to associate with a cue point.

name: name
desc: Specifies the cue point name. This value must match one of the names listed in the [`cue`](@/chunk/cue.md) chunk' cue-point table.

name: text
desc: Specifies a NULL-terminated string containing a text label.

name: id
desc: The ‘note’ chunk contains comment text for a cue point

name: name
desc: Specifies the cue point name. This value must match one of the names listed in the [`cue`](@/chunk/cue.md) chunk' cue-point table.

name: text
desc: Specifies a NULL-terminated string containing comment text.

name: id
desc: The “ ltxt” chunk contains text that is associated with a data segment of specific length

name: name
desc: Specifies the cue point name. This value must match one of the names listed in the [`cue`](@/chunk/cue.md) chunk' cue-point table.

name: sample_length
desc: Specifies the number of samples in the segment of waveform data.

name: purpose
desc: Specifies the type or purpose of the text. For example, dwPurpose can specify a FOURCC code like 'scrp' for script text or 'capt' for close-caption text.

name: country_code
desc: Specifies the country code for the text. See "Country Codes" in [`CSET`](@/chunk/cset.md) chunk, for a current list of country codes.

name: language
desc: Specify the language for the text. See "Language and Dialect Codes" in [`CSET`](@/chunk/cset.md) chunk, for a current list of language and dialect codes.

name: dialect
desc: Specify the dialect codes for the text. See "Language and Dialect Codes" in [`CSET`](@/chunk/cset.md) chunk, for a current list of language and dialect codes.

name: code_page
desc: Specifies the code page for the text. See [`CSET`](@/chunk/cset.md) chunk for details.

name: id
desc: The 'file' chunk contains information described in other file formats (for example, an 'RDIB' file or an ASCII text file).

name: name
desc: Specifies the cue point name. This value must match one of the names listed in the [`cue`](@/chunk/cue.md) chunk' cue-point table.

name: media_type
desc: Specifies the cue point name. This value must match one of the names listed in the <cue-ck> cue-point table.Specifies the file type contained in the fileData field. If the fileData section contains a RIFF form, the dwMedType field is the same as the RIFF form type for the file. This field can contain a zero value.

name: file_data
desc: Contains the media file.

name: id
desc: MD5 audio data checksum.

name: size
desc: size is always 16 bytes.

name: md5
desc: MD5 checksum of the data chunk, not including the optional badding byte.

name: id
desc: The ‘slnt’ chunk represents silence, not necessarily a repeated zero volume or baseline sample.

name: samples
desc: Number of samples.

name: id
desc: This is the same as WRID>RIFF-WAVE>data, it can also be enclosed in this list type.

name: unshifted_note
desc: MIDI note number that corresponds to the unshifted pitch of the sample. Valid values range from 0 to 127.

name: fine_tune
desc: Pitch shift adjustment in cents (or 100ths of a semitone) needed to hit `unshifted_note` value exactly. `fine_tune` can be used to compensate for tuning errors in the sampling process. Valid values range from -50 to 50.

name: gain
desc: Suggested volume setting for the sample in decibels. A value of zero decibels suggests no change in the volume. A value of -6 decibels suggests reducing the amplitude of the sample by two.

name: low_note
desc: Suggested usable MIDI note number range of the sample. Valid values range from 0 to 127.

name: high_note
desc: Suggested usable MIDI note number range of the sample. Valid values range from 0 to 127.

name: low_velocity
desc: Suggested usable MIDI velocity range of the sample. Valid values range from 0 to 127.

name: high_velocity
desc: Suggested usable MIDI velocity range of the sample. Valid values range from 0 to 127.

name: unshifted_note
desc: MIDI note number that corresponds to the unshifted pitch of the sample. Valid values range from 0 to 127.
